title: Understanding SQL COUNT and GROUP BY
text: The COUNT function in SQL is used to count the number of rows that match a specified condition. The GROUP BY statement groups rows that have the same values into summary rows, like "find the number of employees in each department."

hintAnswer: SELECT COUNT(EmployeeID) FROM Employees GROUP BY Department;
title: Identify the Correct SQL Structure
text: Which SQL structure allows you to count the number of employees in each department?
choices: SELECT Department FROM Employees GROUP BY COUNT(EmployeeID);
SELECT COUNT(EmployeeID) FROM Employees GROUP BY Department;

title: Using GROUP BY in SQL
text: The GROUP BY clause is used in collaboration with the SELECT statement to arrange identical data into groups. This is often used with aggregate functions like COUNT, SUM, AVG, etc.

hintAnswer: SELECT COUNT(EmployeeID) FROM Employees GROUP BY Department;
